result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. David M. BRANDT

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant in custody on WRIT.
The State moves to dismiss and read in both counts.  The defendant plead to charges in 13 CF 450.  Motion granted.
Minutes.

Writ of Habeas Corpus Ad Prosequendum and Order to Sheriff to transport defendant for a plea hearing on May 1, 2014, from Trempealeau County Health Care Center.
Copy filed.
Notice of Motion; Defendant's Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.
State's Motion and Demand for Discovery.

Defendant in custody on WRIT.
Defendant waives his right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 3 for trial.
ARRAIGNMENT - 
Information filed. Copy served on defense counsel.
Not guilty pleas entered.  Jury calendar.
Settlement conference with District Attorney is set for 04-22-14 at 11:30 a.m.
Plea date is set for 05-01-14 at 11:30 a.m.
Waiver of Right to Preliminary Hearing.
Minutes.

Writ of Habeas Corpus Ad Prosequendum and Order to Sheriff to transport defendant for his preliminary hearing on 03-13-14 at 10:00 a.m. from Trempealeau County Health Care Center.
Copy filed.
Preliminary hearing is reset to 03-13-14 at 10:00 a.m.

Defendant in custody on WRIT.
The defendant withdraws his request for a competency evaluation.
The defendant demands a preliminary hearing on all cases and waives the statutory time period within which a preliminary hearing must be held.
Preliminary hearing is set for 03-11-14 at 1:30 p.m.
Minutes.

Writ of Habeas Corpus Ad Prosequendum and Order to Sheriff to transport defendant for his status conference/initial appearance on 02-19-14 at 11:00 a.m.
Copy filed.
Status conference is reset to 02-19-14 at 11:00 a.m.

Defense counsel states the defendant is in the custody of DHSS.  
Court continues this matter until 02-07-14 at 9:30 a.m. in Branch 3.  
Minutes.

Defendant in custody.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crimes of bail jumping and disorderly conduct.  The matters are continued for initial appearance on 01-13-14 at 2:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $500.00 recognizance bond with the condition that he have no assaultive contact with David B. Brandt.   Bail furnished and defendant is released from custody.
Probable Cause Statement and Judicial Determination.
Minutes.
